question: when were the words under god added to the pledge
api_result: The words "under God" were added to the Pledge of Allegiance in the United States on June 14, 1954. This addition was made during the Cold War era, as a response to the perceived threat of communist atheism. President Dwight D. Eisenhower encouraged Congress to include these words to distinguish the United States from the Soviet Union, which promoted state atheism.
